newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil southern rail section to go on sale in Rio.
newsitem.headline: Brazil southern rail section to go on sale in Rio.

text.p: A 30-year concession to run the southern section of Brazil's federal railway network will be auctioned off on the Rio de Janeiro stock exchange today at 1400 local time (1600 GMT), a stock exchange spokeswoman said.
The 4,100 mile (6,600 km) network which connects Brazil to Argentina and Uruguay will be auctioned at a base price of 158 million reais ($151.9 million).

The southern railway runs through some of Brazil's most prosperous territory in the states of Parana, Santa Catarina and Rio Grande do Sul, carrying grains, oil and alcohol. Last year, it transported 13.6 million tonnes of freight.
Two consortia, one led by investment bank Bozano, Simonsen and Montagens e Projetos Especiais (MPE) and the other led by investment bank Banco Garantia are expected to bid in the auction.
The winning bidder will have to pay 20 percent of the total amount in cash immediately with the balance to be paid after a two-year grace period in 112 quarterly installments.
The southern railway is the fifth of six federal railway sections to be privatized.
-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151
